title: SAARC Finance Ministers: Meet now to help Sri Lanka
snippet: I suggest Sri Lanka calls for an urgent meeting of Finance Ministers of SAARC countries immediately, to be held in Colombo, to discuss how they can help Sri Lanka get out of its present economic crisis,

title: BCS Sri Lanka Section elects new leadership for 2022/23
snippet: The Chartered Institute for IT (Sri Lanka Section) elected its new leadership for the year 2022/23 at the Annual General Meeting held virtually recently. The new Sri Lanka leadership team consists of the Executive Committee led by Chairman Vajeendra S Kandegamage.

title: Sri Lanka President set up economic committee
snippet: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has set up an economic committee chaired by himself with key ministers and secretaries to formulate economic policies and implement them, Information Minister Dallas Alahapperuma said.

title: Merits of automatic fuel pricing
snippet: Sri Lanka currently has taken a laissez faire approach. The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CEYPETCO) has the base price of gasoline, diesel, and kerosene set by the Government, and leaves the Lanka Indian Oil Company (Lanka IOC) free to set its own.

title: China to provide Ukraine humanitarian aid, praises Russia ties
snippet: China's Red Cross will provide humanitarian aid to Ukraine "as soon as possible", Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on Monday, as he praised his country's friendship with Russia as "rock solid". China has refused to condemn Russia's attack on ...

title: Overwhelming support for Sri Lanka at the Interactive Dialogue at the Human Rights Council
snippet: Sri Lanka received overwhelming support from countries of the Global South at the Interactive Dialogue on the written update of the High Commissioner for Human Rights on Sri Lanka, which concluded on Monday (7 March).

title: Gampaha District Athletic champions
snippet: 35th Annual Masters Athletics Championships organized by the Sri Lanka Masters Athletics Association was held at the Sugathadasa Stadium, Colombo recently with the participation of a large number of master's athletes from all parts of the country and also from foreign countries in the region.

title: SLAF shramadana campaign to protect environment
snippet: A shramadana campaign was held in Colombo on Saturday with the active participation of over 3,000 Sri Lanka Air Force personnel in parallel to the 71st Air Force Day Celebration 2022. The main aim of this programme is to eliminate the dengue breeding places and to keep the environment clean.

title: Sri Lanka in talks with Iran Tea Association to boost exports
snippet: Sri Lanka Embassy in Iran talks with Iran importers to expand the market for tea in Iran with a downward trend has been observed by the Iran Importers for the Ceylon tea in the market, the state information office said.

title: Sri Lanka interest rate hike not enough, rupee cannot be held at 230: Harsha
snippet: ECONOMYNEXT - Sri Lanka devaluation of the rupee to 230 to the US dollar will not help avert the foreign exchange crisis and the one percent rate hike was insufficient with inflation running double digits, opposition legislator Harsha de Silva said.

title: Health Ministry refutes rumours of lower testing rates
snippet: Responding to reports where it is stated that number of daily cases has gone down due to the lower testing rates, the Health Ministry said there is nothing of that sort. ..

title: Sri Lanka rupee official rate falls to Rs229 to US dollar, a historic low
snippet: Sri Lanka's rupee selling rate fell to a historic low of 229.99 to the US dollar according to indicative rates quoted by the central bank after the rupee was allowed to fall to 230 to the US dollar on March 08.

title: Ranil says no national govt. but calls for all parties to unite to come out of crises
snippet: Rumours have been rife that UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe is in talks with Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to form a national government amidst the ongoing crises,

title: Iran won't back down on its 'red lines' in nuclear talks: Raisi
snippet: Iran will not back down on its red lines in nuclear talks with major powers, President Ebrahim Raisi said on Tuesday, after the European Union said the time had come for Washington and Tehran to take political decisions needed to reach an accord.

title: Emergent Cold secures 4-acre land in Muthurajawela to set up cold room facility
snippet: The U.S.-based temperature-controlled storage provider and Sri Lanka's largest temperature controlled 3PL service provider Emergent Cold has secured a 4-acre land in Muthurajawela Industrial Zone belonging to Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation on long-term lease to set up a cold room facility.

title: Rush for tough reforms seen as February foreign reserves slip
snippet: The external sector pain continued unabated as foreign exchange reserves slipped, though just under 2.0 percent in February to US$ 2,314 million from US$ 2,361 million as outflows still showed no restraint while the inflows such as remittances dried up due to unrealistic exchange rate which the Central Bank hung on to for months.

title: Increasing women's political participation in Sri Lanka
snippet: Democracy, by its very definition, calls for the representation of all citizens. Hence, women in politics are essential for representative governance. ..

title: SLI introduces 'Jana Rekuma' to extend insurance for masses
snippet: Sri Lanka Insurance (SLI) introduces 'Jana Rakuma' individual personal accident cover to extend the benefits of insurance to the general masses of Sri Lanka. ..

title: LankaPay cards offer lowest merchant commission at 1%
snippet: Taking another gigantic leap towards harnessing financial inclusivity, LankaPay national payment network makes its debut in the payment card industry in Sri Lanka with the introduction of the LankaPay Card.

title: Stock market plunges after CB devalues rupee
snippet: Sri Lankan shares fell 4 percent to a near four-month low yesterday after the country's Central Bank devalued the rupee in a move seen as a step towards securing an International Monetary Fund loan programme and help negotiate debt restructuring.

title: NTB expands digital banking services with Keells - Hokandara CRM
snippet: Nations Trust Bank (NTB) has expanded the physical touchpoints seamlessly by connecting its digital banking capabilities through the bank's ATM network with its latest cash deposits and withdrawal machine located at Keells Supermarket in Hokandara.

title: Rains drench Sydney, forcing snap evacuations
snippet: Flood warnings stretched across Australia's east coast on Tuesday and tens of thousands of Sydney residents fled their homes as torrential rains again pummelled the country's largest city, flooding several big suburbs.

title: CB to provide more details on new exchange rate policy, incentive schemes
snippet: The Central Bank (CB) is expected to come up with more details on the new exchange rate policy today after deciding to "float" the rupee while issuing a "guidance" to maintain the currency at Rs.230 against the US dollar,

title: CB gets deferral of US$ 900mn payment from ACU
snippet: Sri Lanka's Central Bank has received a two-month deferral for US$ 900 million in payments due this week to the Asian Clearing Union (ACU), multiple sources said, helping ease pressure on its meager reserves amid its worst financial crisis in years.

title: Updated UK travel advisory puts damper
snippet: The government of the United Kingdom (UK) revised this week the travel advisory for its citizens entering Sri Lanka, and the update paints a grim picture of the island nation and the worsening economic situation.

title: Banks await operating instructions on new worker remittance incentive
snippet: While the government yesterday announced that it would increase the incentive given to migrant worker dollars, the Central Bank has informed banks that it would discontinue the Rs.8.00 incentive offered for such inflows effective from March 9,

title: Government to establish centralised economic decision-making body under President
snippet: The 'Economic Council' to have 11 members including PM, Finance Minister, CB Governor and Treasury Secy. Will convene weekly; first meeting this week Mandated with instructing and guiding the implementation of decisions taken by ministries, depts.

title: All residential and commercial buildings to go under microscope
snippet: All the residential and commercial multi-storey buildings in the country, especially condominiums, are to go under the microscope, which may lead to hefty fines or demolition. The Urban Development Authority (UDA) is going to constitute an independent advisory committee consisting of architects and engineers to review approvals and check building violations of existing structures.

title: Maldivians urged to visit Sri Lanka with lifting of mandatory PCR tests
snippet: It is expected that many Maldivian and foreign nationals would be encouraged to travel to Sri Lanka with the easing of travel restrictions and the superior service and facilities provided by the Traveller Global. (Colombo Gazette)

title: Tourist arrivals in first nine weeks of 2022 surpass total arrivals in 2021
snippet: Sri Lanka welcomed over 25,000 tourists in the first week of March, bringing the total number of arrivals to cross the 200,000 mark. ..

title: Art as a medium of #Breakingthebias
snippet: The Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art Sri Lanka's current exhibition "Encounters" aims to structure a sequence of changing displays that bring together six encounters between artworks and ephemera from the 1950s to the present.

title: Manufacturers, importers stop supplying medicine to pharmacies from yesterday
snippet: After the decision by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) to devalue the rupee against the US dollar to Rs. 230, the mainline medicine manufacturing companies and importers are contemplating to stop supplying medicine to pharmacies from yesterday,

title: Sri Lanka power crisis to affect parliament; speaker asks MPs to brace themselves
snippet: Sri Lanka's Speaker of Parliament Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena has requested lawmakers' cooperation in managing the electricity situation in the parliament complex as the country's ongoing power crisis worsens.

title: Sri Lanka Comes Closer to IMF Aid Option After Rupee Plunge
snippet: Sri Lanka's painful decision to effectively devalue its currency this week could pave the way for the island nation to get help from the International Monetary Fund as a $1 billion debt payment looms in four months.
